title.narrative: STRENGTHENING LEGISLATION THROUGH REDS

description.narrative: National capacity is strengthened in legislation, planning and budgeting for equitable access to essential high impact maternal and child health interventions using REDS Strategy, by end 2016, which contributes to Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Health And Emergencies, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Polio Eradication. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased use of services and strengthened good practices for the fulfilment of young child's rights to health, nutrition, protection and school readiness, particularly for marginalised children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National capacity is strengthened in legislation, planning and budgeting for equitable access to essential high impact maternal andchild health interventions using REDS Strategy, by end 2016

description.narrative: While coverage of health and nutrition services increased in key geographic areas, at central level national guidelines on Community Integrated Management of Childhood Illnesses were adopted by the Ministry of Health, and the vaccine hesitancy survey and draft MCH Law were successfully completed, addressing key supply and demand bottlenecks. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2017

title.narrative: Percentage of health facilities in focus areas received and utilized local budget for implementation of Reaching Every District Strategy
A comprehensive RMNCAH communication plan (incorporating malaria, pneumonia and diarrhoea, PMTCT, immunisation, polio and child development) is developed, budgeted and implemented
National C4D strategy developed and implemented in focus areas
National EENC plan developed with cost and implemented in selected areas
National Law on MNCH is drafted and budgeted
UNICEF-targeted children 6 months to 15 years in humanitarian situations who are vaccinated against measles
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) IPV introduced into routine immunization schedules and country switched from trivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (tOPV) to bivalent Oral Polio Vaccine (bOPV)
